Public Affairs (UPA)  US Legal Studies (USL)           Home / All Course Descriptions / Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery (OSUR)   Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery (OSUR)             Courses   OSUR 320.  Pain Control I: Local Anesthesia.  1 hour.  Pain control; local anesthesia. Course Information: Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the Doctor of Dental Surgery program.    OSUR 323.  Introduction to Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery.  1 hour.  Surgical principles, technique, patient evaluations, medical-dental management, surgical complications, symptomology, medical emergencies, dentoaveolar infections, medicolegal considerations of oral and maxillofacial surgery. Course Information: Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the Doctor of Dental Surgery program.    OSUR 332.  Basic Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery.  1 hour.  Evaluational, diagnostic and procedural aspects of practice: surgical extractions, impacted teeth, preprosthetic surgery, space infections, pathology and biopsy, radiation, neuropathology and trauma. Course Information: Prerequisite(s): OSUR 323 .    OSUR 333.  Pain Control II.  1 hour.  Techniques of sedation and management of complications under anesthesia. Course Information: Prerequisite(s): OSUR 320 .    OSUR 334.  Internal Medicine for Dental Students.  1 hour.  Covers theories and basic principles of internal medicine as applied to the organ systems and approaches to management of patients with common system diseases.  Course Information:  Previously listed as OMDS 333.    OSUR 337.  Oral and Maxillofacial Clinic I.  1 hour.  Clinical practice of exodontia, dentoalveolar surgery and minor oral surgical procedure as encountered in general practice of dentistry. Course Information: Prerequisite(s): OSUR 323 .    OSUR 342.  Advanced Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery.  1 hour.  Advanced level discussion of medical-dental management, surgical and medical emergencies, surgical complications, diagnostic procedures, dentofacial deformities, clefts, reconstructive surgery, surgery and managed care, criteria for referral. Course Information: Prerequisite(s): OSUR 332 .    OSUR 343.  Medical Emergencies in the Dental Office.  1 hour.  Recognition and management of the medical emergency in the dental office will be taught with major emphasis on problem solving. Course Information: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the third year in the Doctor of Dental Surgery program.    OSUR 344.  Implant Dentistry.  1 hour.  History of implantology, prosthetic and surgical aspects to implant reconstruction are described. Laboratory sessions allow students to have hands-on experience. Course Information: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the third year clinical requirements in the Doctor of Dental Surgery program or consent of the course director.    OSUR 347.  Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery Clinic II.  1 hour.  Continues OMFS 337. Clinical practice of exodontia, dentalaveolar surgery and minor oral surgical procedures as encountered in general practice of dentistry. Course Information: Prerequisite(s): OSUR 337 .    OSUR 610.  Conscious Sedation and General Anesthesia.  1 hour.  Lectures on pharmacology, pharmakodynamics, medical emergencies, drug interaction, and pain and anxiety control supplemented with clinical experience in administration of general anesthetic and inhalation and intravenous sedatives. Course Information: Previously listed as OSUR 510. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Certificate Program or approval of the department. Class Schedule Information: To be properly registered, students must enroll in one Lecture and one Clinical Practice.    OSUR 611.  Oral Surgery Seminar.  2 hours.  Lectures, seminars, conferences, grand rounds, and journal club dealing with current topics of clinical and research interest. Course Information: Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grading only. May be repeated to a maximum of 24 hours of credit. Previously listed as OSUR 511. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Certificate Program or approval of the department.    OSUR 613.  Craniofacial Deformity Seminar.  1 hour.  Discusses the investigation, evaluation, treatment planning and follow-up monitoring of patients with dentofacial deformities. Course Information: Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grading only. May be repeated to a maximum of 12 hours of credit.  Previously listed as OSUR 513. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Certificate Progarm or approval of the department.    OSUR 614.  Clinical Pathology Conference.  1 hour.  Discussion and presentation of clinical and histological variations of a wide spectrum of diseases and conditions seen within the scope of oral and maxillofacial surgeons. Course Information: Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grading only. May be repeated to a maximum of 8 hours. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Cerficate Program or approval of the department.    OSUR 619.  Implant Diagnosis and Treatment Planning Seminar.  1 hour.  Implant case presentations and discussions focusing on diagnosis of surgical and prosthetic treatment planning and complications management. Course Information: Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grading only. May be repeated to a maximum of 4 hours. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Cerficate Program or approval of the department.    OSUR 620.  Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery Clinic.  2-20 hours.  Practical experience dealing with the surgical treatment of patients in a clinical and hospital setting. Course Information: Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grading only. May be repeated. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Cerficate Program or approval of the department.    OSUR 623.  Applied Surgical Anatomy.  1 hour.  Advanced head and neck anatomy and surgical approaches to common problems and extensive review of anatomical relationships. Presentations of various surgical techniques and instrumentation. Course Information: Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grading only. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Certificate Program or approval of the department.    OSUR 624.  Morbidity and Mortality Conference.  1 hour.  Case presentation and discussion of current and past surgical complications and adverse outcomes focusing on preventive and management aspects. Course Information: Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grading only. May be repeated to a maximum of 4 hours. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Certificate Program or approval of the department.    OSUR 633.  Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery Literature Review.  1 hour.  Methodology for critical review of medical literature and discuss key articles appearing in appropriate medical and dental journals. Course Information: Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grading only. May be repeated to a maximum of 4 hours of credit. Previously listed as OSUR 533. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Certificate or approval of the department.    OSUR 661.  Physical Diagnosis.  4 hours.  In-depth methods of obtaining a history and performing physical diagnosis of the entire body through theoretical and practical lesions. Course Information: Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grading only. Previously listed as OSUR 561. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Certificate Program or approval of the department. Class Schedule Information: To be properly registered, students must enroll in on Lecture and one Clinical Practice.    OSUR 698.  Research in Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery.  0-16 hours.  Students design and conduct a research project with faculty guidance. Course Information: Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grading only. May be repeated. Prerequisite(s): Enrollment in the OMFS Certificate Program.
